title: tread93
author: tread93
content: Alright guys, i'm going to be looking at opening up an account on one of these sports betting sites for the weekend football games  What should I bet on? I am thinking maybe putting down like $50-$100 just for shits and giggles. (I never really gamble at all).

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: It depends on what bets you're looking for. Parlaying the big favorites (Chiefs, Eagles, and 49ers all to win at 1.75) would be the safe play, but that's just me if i'm desperate for a win this week. Only the Chiefs are playing on the road, but it shouldn't be a problem against the Jets, who recently lost their main QB due to an injury.If you prefer singles over parlays, then the Bengals, Bills, and Browns are worth checking out at 1.70~ odds each, depending on your sportsbook. The Bengals are the only road team between these three, but their opponent (Titans) isn't as impressive if you look at their stats.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on September 29, 2023, 12:59:21 AMAlright guys, i'm going to be looking at opening up an account on one of these sports betting sites for the weekend football games  What should I bet on? I am thinking maybe putting down like $50-$100 just for shits and giggles. (I never really gamble at all). That's a good amount of money, but I recommend analyzing bets on your own. Personally, $50-$100 is already a significant sum to me, and I wouldn't trust anyone else to make betting decisions for me. Trust me, the satisfaction is much greater when you're the one selecting your bets based on your own analysis. I suggest looking at statistics and perhaps consulting betting forums to gather some tips, but ultimately, the final decision should be yours.

comments.body: Quote from: tread93 on September 29, 2023, 12:59:21 AMWhat should I bet on?If you do not know the matches you waupoosed to bet on, then do not gamble. When I was using prediction sites, I still make sure I analyse those matches myself.
